msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 606 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4562; Text: Q 2:13-Q 114:6; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 365 x 290 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, pp. 11-12: "42 Y. 4562 Aynı Parşömen. 290mm boy ve 365mm eninde cönk şeklinde 606 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 300mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Tahminen III. (IX) asırda yazılmıştır. Baştan 3 yaprağı ile sure başları tezhiplidir. III. Osman’ın vakıf mührünü ve kaydını havidir. Tahta üzerine kahve rengi deri cildin kapakları arabesk geçmelerle süslü olup üst kapağın tezyınatı mustal[t]il ve alt kapağının müdevver şekildedir; üzerinde demir halkalar vardır. Bu mushafın baş kısmı eksik olup Baḳara (2) suresinin 13. ayeti ile başlar."

This can be translated as follows: "42 Y. 4562 Same Parchment. 606 junk shaped leaves of 290 mm height and 365 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 14 lines measuring 300 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd (9th) century. Its first three leaves and sūra beginnings are gilded. Contains waqf registration and seal of Osman III. The covers of the brown leather binding on wooden [board] are decorated with interlaced arabesque [forms]. The decoration of the upper cover is rectangular, and the lower cover is circular and there are iron rings on it. The beginning of this codex is missing, and it starts with Q 2:13 (Sūra al-Baqara)."
